filmography.title: The White Sister
filmography.role_description: A dashing Italian army officer who returns from the dead to find his true love has become a nun.
filmography.plot: A young woman enters a convent after believing her lover has been killed in war, only to face a crisis of faith when he returns alive.

filmography.title: The Dark Angel
filmography.role_description: A World War I officer who feigns death to release his fiancée from the burden of caring for him after he is blinded.
filmography.plot: A soldier blinded in war hides his survival from the woman he loves so she can marry his rival and live a happier life.

filmography.title: Stella Dallas
filmography.role_description: A refined but fallen socialite who marries beneath his station, eventually leaving his wife to restore his daughter's social standing.
filmography.plot: A high-society man marries a working-class woman, but their class differences eventually tear their family apart.

filmography.title: Lady Windermere's Fan
filmography.role_description: A sophisticated man-about-town who pursues the married Lady Windermere in this silent adaptation of Oscar Wilde's play.
filmography.plot: A society woman suspects her husband of having an affair, unaware that the 'other woman' is actually her own disgraced mother trying to save her reputation.

filmography.title: Beau Geste
filmography.role_description: A noble English gentleman who joins the French Foreign Legion to protect his family's honor after a valuable gem is stolen.
filmography.plot: Three brothers join the Foreign Legion to hide a secret about a stolen diamond, facing a sadistic sergeant in the deserts of North Africa.

filmography.title: The Winning of Barbara Worth
filmography.role_description: An eastern engineer who travels West to build an irrigation system and competes with a local cowboy for a woman's hand.
filmography.plot: A rivalry develops between an engineer and a cowboy as they try to reclaim the desert for agriculture and win the heart of a rancher's daughter.

filmography.title: The Night of Love
filmography.role_description: A gypsy leader who kidnaps a princess for revenge against the duke who wronged him, only to fall in love with her.
filmography.plot: A gypsy swears vengeance on a cruel duke by stealing his bride on their wedding night.

filmography.title: Bulldog Drummond
filmography.role_description: A bored WWI veteran who advertises his services as an adventurer and gets embroiled in a dangerous rescue mission.
filmography.plot: A former British officer seeking excitement places an ad in the paper and is hired to rescue a young woman's uncle from a criminal asylum.

filmography.title: Condemned
filmography.role_description: A charming thief sent to Devil's Island who falls in love with the warden's wife and plots a daring escape.
filmography.plot: A convict on Devil's Island falls in love with the warden's unhappy wife and plans to break out to be with her.

filmography.title: Raffles
filmography.role_description: A gentleman cricketer who moonlights as a notorious jewel thief known as 'The Amateur Cracksman'.
filmography.plot: A society gentleman leads a double life as a famous jewel thief, engaging in a battle of wits with Scotland Yard while trying to help a friend.

filmography.title: Arrowsmith
filmography.role_description: An idealistic doctor torn between the demands of scientific research and the comforts of a private medical practice.
filmography.plot: A dedicated medical researcher struggles to balance his career and personal life while fighting a plague outbreak in the West Indies.

filmography.title: Cynara
filmography.role_description: A barrister whose brief, innocent affair with a shopgirl while his wife is away leads to scandal and tragedy.
filmography.plot: A successful lawyer's life is ruined when a casual affair with a lonely shopgirl ends in her suicide.

filmography.title: The Masquerader
filmography.role_description: A dual role as a drug-addicted politician and his identical cousin, a journalist who steps in to save his career.
filmography.plot: A journalist impersonates his politician cousin to save his reputation and the country during a political crisis.

filmography.title: Clive of India
filmography.role_description: The controversial British soldier and administrator who established British supremacy in India.
filmography.plot: A biographical film following the rise of Robert Clive from a clerk to the conqueror of India for the British Empire.

filmography.title: A Tale of Two Cities
filmography.role_description: A brilliant but dissolute lawyer who finds redemption through his unrequited love, culminating in a supreme sacrifice.
filmography.plot: In the French Revolution, a disillusioned English lawyer sacrifices his life to save the husband of the woman he loves.

filmography.title: Under Two Flags
filmography.role_description: A British aristocrat who takes the blame for his brother's crime and joins the French Foreign Legion under an assumed name.
filmography.plot: A Foreign Legionnaire is torn between a beautiful aristocrat and a fiery cafe girl while serving in the Sahara.

filmography.title: Lost Horizon
filmography.role_description: An idealistic British diplomat who crashes in the Himalayas and discovers the utopian lamasery of Shangri-La.
filmography.plot: A plane crash leads a group of civilians to a hidden paradise in the Himalayas where people live for centuries.

filmography.title: The Prisoner of Zenda
filmography.role: Major Rudolf Rassendyll / King Rudolf V
filmography.role_description: A dual role as an English gentleman and the King of Ruritania, who he impersonates to foil a coup attempt.
filmography.plot: An Englishman on holiday is forced to impersonate the King of a small European nation to prevent his wicked half-brother from seizing the throne.

filmography.title: If I Were King
filmography.role_description: The roguish French poet who is made Grand Constable of France for a week by the wily King Louis XI.
filmography.plot: A poet and thief is given the chance to rule France for a week after insulting the King in a tavern.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actor (Basil Rathbone)

filmography.title: The Light That Failed
filmography.role_description: A stubborn artist who races to finish his masterpiece before going completely blind from a war injury.
filmography.plot: An artist goes blind from an injury received in the Sudan, destroying his painting career and complicating his love life.

filmography.title: The Talk of the Town
filmography.role_description: A stuffy law professor whose views on justice are challenged when he ends up sharing a cottage with an escaped convict.
filmography.plot: A fugitive hiding out in a rental home tries to prove his innocence with the help of a schoolteacher and a Supreme Court nominee.

filmography.title: Random Harvest
filmography.role_description: A shell-shocked WWI veteran who forgets his past life and marries a showgirl, only to regain his memory and forget her.
filmography.plot: An amnesiac veteran rebuilds his life with a woman he loves, only to have a shock restore his old memories and erase his new ones.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actor; Oscar: Nomination – Best Picture

filmography.title: Kismet
filmography.role_description: The wily 'King of Beggars' in ancient Baghdad who schemes to marry his daughter to a prince.
filmography.plot: A beggar-magician masquerades as a prince to help his daughter marry royalty and outwit the wicked Grand Vizier.

filmography.title: The Late George Apley
filmography.role_description: A stuffy, traditional Boston aristocrat who struggles to adapt to the changing world and his children's modern choices.
filmography.plot: A wealthy Bostonian tries to arrange his children's lives according to tradition, but they have ideas of their own.

filmography.title: A Double Life
filmography.role_description: A famous stage actor who becomes so immersed in his role as Othello that he begins to lose his grip on reality.
filmography.plot: An actor playing Othello becomes possessed by the character's jealousy and homicidal rage, blurring the line between stage and life.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actor; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actor

filmography.title: Champagne for Caesar
filmography.role_description: An erudite genius who goes on a quiz show to bankrupt a soap company he despises.
filmography.plot: An unemployed scholar becomes a contestant on a quiz show, aiming to win the entire company of the show's sponsor.

filmography.title: The Story of Mankind
filmography.role_description: A celestial entity who argues the case for humanity's survival before a divine tribunal; Colman's final film role.
filmography.plot: The Spirit of Man and the Devil argue over whether humanity is worth saving, presenting examples from history.
